result.execSummary:
The defendant Gino V Madosh was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay all costs, assessments, victim witness surcharges, DNA surcharge, image surcharge (5, total of $2,500.00).
To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervisoin.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
*12/14/2016 amended to reflect a single $500.00 child pornography surcharge.

Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all approriate costs.
Register as a sex offender.
Defendant advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor; and that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.

per order dated September 8, 2016, Appeal 2015XX1614CR, the State shall, no later than September 22, 2016, file a response to Madosh's motion for an extension of the deadline to file a postconviction motion or a notice of appeal.
State Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel.

per order dated March 24, 2016, Appeal 2015XX1614CR, the State Public Defender shall appoint new counsel for Madosh within thirty days of the date of this order. Successor counsel shall provide this court with a copy of his or her appointment order within five days of the date of appointment. Masdaosh, but sucessor counsel, shall file a postconviction motion or notice of appeal within sixty days of the date on which sucessor counsel is appointed. The public defender shall provide sucessor counsel with a copy of this order.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Gino V Madosh in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded as to count 1: Statements by the state, defense and defendant.
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 7 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 14 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 4 YEARS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS with the following conditions:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges, DNA surcharge.
-Pay image surcharge (5, total of $2500.00).
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
-Register as a sex offender.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.   
Court remands defendant, defendant to report to Dodge Correctional.
Filed:
Written explanation of determinate sentence
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Gino V Madosh in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pursuant to negotiations, this matter has been resolved.  Defendant is to plead to count 1 and counts 2,3,4,5 are ordered dismissed and read in for sentencing.  The state believes that the defendant should be assessed the IMAGE SURCHARGE only as to count 1.
AS to count 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Defendant must register as a sex offender and my be subject to Chapter 980 filings.   Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   
Case is adjourned to 6-11-2015 at 8:15 for sentencing.

Defendant Gino V Madosh in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
Present in court is Justice Point Elise Josephson.  Case in court due to violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant.  No action taken at this time. violation Court ill issue warrant for arrest. Case remains scheduled for final pretrial 05-21-2015.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 750.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs in court.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
Defendant failing to appear, the Court ordered a bench warrant to issue.  The Court ordered cash bond/signature bond forfeited.  The Court ordered Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office.    COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs in court, defendant Gino V Madosh not in court, in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference conducted.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 08:15 am.

  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.   
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
